<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Figure out the largest discriminator issued for each Location. When we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// issue new discriminators, we can thus avoid issuing discriminators</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// belonging to instructions that don&#39;t have memops. This isn&#39;t a requirement</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// for the goals of this pass, however, it avoids unnecessary ambiguity.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Keep track of the discriminators seen at each Location. If an instruction&#39;s</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// FIXME(mtrofin): The assumption is that this scenario is infrequent/OK</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// not to support. If evidence points otherwise, we can explore synthesizeing</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// unique DIs by adding fake line numbers, or by constructing 64 bit</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// discriminators.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><Highlight kind="normal">          <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/debug-h/#a196897517069dda1bdb549e24468f7d7">LLVM&#95;DEBUG</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7c46c742c31be54870e2038048e6b391">dbgs</a>() &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Unable to create a unique discriminator &quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><Highlight kind="normal">                     </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;for instruction with memory operand in: &quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><Highlight kind="normal">                     &lt;&lt; DI-&gt;getFilename() &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot; Line: &quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;&lt; DI-&gt;getLine()</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><Highlight kind="normal">                     &lt;&lt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;. This is likely due to a large macro expansion. \\n&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">continue</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><Highlight kind="normal">        &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><Highlight kind="normal">        ++MemOpDiscriminators&#91;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ead20caec3b48a1eef164cb4ca81ba2587">L</a>&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><Highlight kind="normal">        std::pair&lt;DenseSet&lt;unsigned&gt;::iterator, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&gt; MustInsert =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><Highlight kind="normal">            <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/objcopy/#aa91a92d1d1ad7e8b84c1ecdceb0a439fa5d5b78699e57104f2fa03bbdf7b9197b">Set</a>.insert(DI-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dilocation/#a959d7d5282de6f6f459425591e7482d7">getBaseDiscriminator</a>());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><Highlight kind="normal">        (void)MustInsert; </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Silence warning in release build.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><Highlight kind="normal">        <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(MustInsert.second &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;New discriminator shouldn&#39;t be present in set&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><Highlight kind="normal">      &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Bump the reference DI to avoid cramming discriminators on line 0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// FIXME(mtrofin): pin ReferenceDI on blocks or first instruction with DI</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// in a block. It&#39;s more consistent than just relying on the last memop</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instruction we happened to see.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><Highlight kind="normal">      ReferenceDI = DI;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
